Row.Text: You have a Center of Progress. The ideas of the Industrial Revolution now permeate your society. Your people clamor for you to pick an Ideology for your civilization.

Ideological tenets may not be purchased until you have chosen an Ideology. This choice becomes available when you build a Center of Progress (requires Factories in every City) or enter the Modern Era, whichever comes first.

Players interested in creating massive, sprawling civs should turn to the Order ideology, as the strength of the empire is determined by the total number of cities it contains. Order becomes available for exploration upon completing a Center of Progress (requires a Factory in every City) or entering the Modern Era.

The Autocracy ideology is well suited for those wishing nothing more than to crush their foes under the weight of their iron-plated boots. This ideology unlocks upon completing a Center of Progress (requires a Factory in every City) or entering the Modern Era, and cannot be active at the same time as Freedom or Order.

The Freedom ideology provides bonuses for Culture, Tourism, Specialist production, and more. Freedom becomes available upon completing a Center of Progress (requires a Factory in every City) or entering the Modern Era, and cannot be active at the same time as Autocracy or Order.
